pr_title: Liquibase - Record service classes implementation instead of  generating a native resource file for each service interface

timeline.bodyText: Should we care about the order here (LinkedHashMap) ?
timeline.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText:
Should we care about the order here (LinkedHashMap) ?

Probably yes, to avoid uncertainty while loading all services, WDYT?
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText:
Should we care about the order here (LinkedHashMap) ?

Probably yes, to avoid uncertainty while loading all services, WDYT?

I do not think so. I think we just need a lookup table here, order is irrelevant. What uncertainty are you thinking of?
replies.author: machi1990

replies.bodyText: Ah nevermind, I thought you were iterating entries. I should stop reviewing code late at night 😛
replies.author: gastaldi

timeline.message:
refactor(liquibase): record service classes implementation instead of generating a native resource file for each service interface

This cleans up the extension processing part a little bit as we can record these info in a registry
and do a map lookup during runtime instead of reading the generated resource file for each service
class
